column4: This seems like it may need a UI. I all have access to is CLI.
the grub configuration command line or linux command line?
I have access through UNetBooten, not through Grub.
ahh. have you tried using the ubuntu liveCD instead?
try this http://www.howopensource.com/2012/05/reinstall-recover-grub-from-ubuntu-12-04-live-cd-usb/
The liveCD needs the proprietary driver. It doesn't even get me to the loading screen. I will try that link.
sorry, when you installed ubuntu, did you use the cd?
I used the alternate install. The live cd needed proprietary driver, so I had no choice.
ahhhh. hmmmm. one sec.
problem is, you're going to need the install cd to repair grub. see here http://howtoubuntu.org/how-to-repairrestorereinstall-grub-2-with-a-ubuntu-live-cd/
is that working for you?
Just checking the BIOS right now, making sure it isn't anything there.
what happens when you try to boot into ubuntu?
can you hold the shift key on reboot and see the grub menu?
I don't get a choice, GRUB fails to initilize.

I Had a problem like this in the past. Installer CD was seeing my first SATA RAID card as /dev0-3 and second as dev4-7. it would install grub but it would fail because the bios saw the second sata card as dev0-3
Which is what i'm checking. Need to clear my CMOS as my bios password seems too secure.
lol
Messing with the Bios seems to have fixed it. Not sure if that means GRUB is installed on a different drive
file -s /dev/sdX should let you know which drive it's on.
try this http://serverfault.com/questions/61400/how-do-i-tell-if-grub-is-installed-on-a-device
I just realized something. If I need to install the proprietary driver... The alternative CD is still useless. Nouvouro doesn't support my video card.
Ahahaa! To GOOOGLE I GO!
